name: Tree Mallow
climate: Tree Mallow thrives in mild temperate climates with no extreme temperatures.
It prefers locations with year-round moderate temperatures without frost.
This plant can adapt to coastal climates with salty air and strong winds.
Avoid placing Tree Mallow in regions with harsh winter conditions.
sunlight: Tree Mallow requires full sun exposure for optimal growth and flowering.
It can also tolerate partial shade, but flowering may be reduced.
Ensure the plant receives at least six hours of direct sunlight daily.
Avoid planting in full shade, as it leads to weak growth and minimal blooms.
watering: Water Tree Mallow regularly but allow the soil to dry between waterings.
It is drought-tolerant once established but appreciates occasional irrigation.
Avoid overwatering, which can lead to root rot and other moisture issues.
During dry spells, increase watering to maintain healthy leaf and bloom production.
soil: Tree Mallow thrives in well-drained, sandy, or loamy soils.
It prefers soil with good drainage to prevent waterlogging and root rot.
The plant can tolerate nutrient-poor soils but benefits from organic matter.
Avoid heavy clay soils, which can retain too much moisture and stifle growth.
toxic: Tree Mallow is generally considered non-toxic to humans and animals.
extra_care_tip: Prune regularly to shape and control size, encouraging bushier growth.
Protect from harsh winds and extreme cold conditions during winter months.
Check for pests like aphids and snails, taking action to manage infestations.
Mulch around the base to retain soil moisture and reduce weed competition.
